newsitem.title: USA: NBA BASKETBALL-MALONE ARRIVES ON MOTORCYCLE, LEAVES IN TRIUMPH.
newsitem.headline: NBA BASKETBALL-MALONE ARRIVES ON MOTORCYCLE, LEAVES IN TRIUMPH.

text.p: Karl Malone is definitely a "just me and my motorcycle" kind of guy.

The Utah Jazz hero in their Game 3 win over the Chicago Bulls Friday arrived at the Delta Centre on a motorcycle, wearing a black, sleeveless t-shirt -- quite a contrast with the defending champions' luxurious style.

"I think these guys started laughing at me because Michael (Jordan) and Scottie (Pippen) were wearing $5,000 suits when they stepped up here, and I came up here with this," Malone said at the post-game news conference.

"I had two or three of my Harleys at home today and my little son likes them all. I was going to get on the one that was kind of quiet and he shook his head, he liked the other one," Malone said, laughing.
"That's the one I rode, because he loves them too and he picked out his favourite one, and I said all right, I'd get on that one.
"People don't always agree with it but those are the things that I like to do away from the court."

He said it helped him prepare for the game. Something did. He dominated with 37 points, 10 rebounds, three assists and four steals to put the Jazz back in a Finals they looked to be in danger of being swept out of.

"Right now you look for anything to get you going, whether it relaxes your mind or anything like that. And I took the long way here, I normally get here at 4:15, I got here today at five minutes to five."

He has been getting many suggestions on treating his ailing right hand. "Everybody in America has sent e-mails and all that, which is great, but I needed that Harley ride today," he said, again laughing.
"And I guarantee you I'm going to take it again on Sunday, too."

Other people's opinions don't mean much to Malone, who was a goat in Game 1 when he missed two key free throws at the end of a close contest and was the brunt of more criticism when the Jazz had a bad loss in Game 2.
"Down 0-2, people didn't want to talk to you. People wanted to kick you in the rear end, now all of a sudden you won a game and they want to pat you on the back.
"I don't want to talk to anybody when I leave this room, and I don't want nobody patting me or nothing. I appreciate the compliment, but like I said, one day ago they wanted to wring your neck."
Malone also was limping after landing hard while snagging a rebound late in the fourth quarter, but he stayed in the game after a timeout.
"It is fine," the big power forward said. "I played the game and I finished the game and I'll be ready to play on Sunday."
